title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges to donate $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund when a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
The donation will be Cora's largest single public contribution to the Boston-based cancer research organization.
Cora previously donated based on Red Sox wins and runs, totaling over $21,000 in 2021.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, which targets courses on critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues.
The act, named after activist Charlie Kirk, passed 184-164, with four Republicans joining Democrats in opposition.
Violating teachers risk discipline or credential revocation, while individuals can sue schools for up to $10,000 per breach.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams, Massachusetts are created using food coloring, a decades-old local tradition.
The Hairpin Turn offers panoramic views of Hoosac Valley and attracts visitors, also home to the historic Golden Eagle Restaurant.
The area features attractions like MASS MoCA and Mount Greylock, enhancing its appeal as a travel destination in winter.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirmed its first two measles cases of 2026: a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The infected adult with an uncertain vaccination history recently traveled abroad and potentially exposed others in Massachusetts.
The child, diagnosed out-of-state, remains there, and has not exposed anyone in Massachusetts to measles.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident, passed away peacefully on February 21, 2026, from a brief illness.
Morgan was known for her work at the City of Boston Inspectional Services and appeared in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial.
She is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello, children Mya and Frankie, and numerous family members and friends.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father.
Hamilton's father, a Boston salesman, passed away from ALS, inspiring her marathon effort.
Her run aims to honor her father's legacy and raise awareness for ALS and its effects on families.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion in response to AG Andrea Campbell's bid to strike her audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio's lawsuit seeks court enforcement for a state Legislature audit, approved by 72% of Massachusetts voters.
AG Campbell argues DiZoglio lacks authority for the lawsuit and claims her office must approve such legal actions.

title: This speech-language therapist is running Boston to fund autism support services
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carrie Kerstein, a speech-language therapist from Cambridge, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the Doug Flutie Jr. Foundation.
The Doug Flutie Jr. Foundation supports autistic individuals by funding services like speech-language therapy to empower families.
Kerstein's marathon effort aims to spread autism understanding and raise funds, aligning her professional work with her passion for running.

title: The City of Boston handed residents $2.2M to decide funding. Here’s what they picked.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston residents directed $2.2 million to fund immigrant legal defense, fresh food access, and housing stability projects.
Over 4,800 residents voted in Boston's Participatory Budgeting Initiative to select and allocate funding to community projects.
Winning initiatives will receive funding this spring, with city departments overseeing project implementation across Boston neighborhoods.

title: Someone allegedly struck her ex’s new girlfriend with a car in Newton. Now both women are facing charges.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Rosa Sanchez, 37, is accused of attempting to kill her ex-boyfriend's new girlfriend, Esneiry Pimentel-Lugo, with a car in Newton.
Police said a physical altercation involving a baseball bat occurred before Sanchez allegedly drove onto a curb to strike Pimentel-Lugo.
Both women pleaded not guilty to charges; Sanchez to attempted murder, and both to assault and battery with a dangerous weapon.
